company.name: Forensics Consulting Solutions, LLC
company.business_description: Forensics Consulting Solutions is an electronic discovery consulting firm that transfers personal data and maintains privacy policies regarding participation in international data protection frameworks.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

complaint.factual_background: Forensics Consulting Solutions, an electronic discovery consulting firm, self-certified to the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework in 2009 but failed to renew its certification in 2012. Despite losing its Safe Harbor status, the company continued to represent on its website from August 2012 until May 2015 that it was a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework, misleading consumers about its privacy compliance.

representations_made.description: Represented that it was a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework through statements on its website
representations_made.quoted_text: 12. From at least August 2012 until May 2015, respondent disseminated or caused to be disseminated privacy policies and statements on its website, www.aboutfcs.com/security- privacy, including but not limited to, the following statements:

counts.title: False Safe Harbor Participation Claims
counts.representation: Respondent represented that it was a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
counts.fact: Beginning in 2012, respondent was not a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 13 is false and misleading.

definitions.respondent: Forensics Consulting Solutions, LLC and its successors and assigns.
definitions.Commerce: as defined in Section 4 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 44.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy or Security Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent its membership in, adherence to, certification by, or participation in any privacy or security program sponsored by government or self-regulatory organizations, including Safe Harbor Frameworks.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent extent to which respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by government or self-regulatory organizations
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that respondent and its officers, agents, representatives, and employees, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service, in or affecting commerce, shall not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any self-regulatory or standard- setting organization, including, but not limited to, the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and the U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain for five years all documents relating to compliance with the order, including advertisements and materials showing representations, and any documents questioning compliance.

requirements.description: Maintain and make available to FTC for inspection all documents relating to compliance with the order for five years from date of preparation or dissemination
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall maintain and upon request make available to the Federal Trade Commission for inspection and copying, a print or electronic copy of, for a period of five (5) years from the date of preparation or dissemination, whichever is later, all documents relating to compliance with this order, including but not limited to:

requirements.description: Maintain all advertisements, promotional materials, and statements containing representations covered by the order, with materials relied upon
requirements.quoted_text: A. all advertisements, promotional materials, and any other statements containing any representations covered by this order, with all materials relied upon in disseminating the representation; and

requirements.description: Maintain any documents that call into question respondent's compliance with the order
requirements.quoted_text: B. any documents, whether prepared by or on behalf of respondent, that call into question respondent’s compliance with this order.

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Distribution
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of the order to current and future personnel with responsibilities relating to the subject matter, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt within thirty days.

requirements.description: Deliver copy of order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives with responsibilities relating to the subject matter
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers, and to all current and future employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this order. Respondent shall deliver this order to such current personnel within thirty (30) days

requirements.description: Deliver order to current personnel within thirty days after service of the order
requirements.quoted_text: this order. Respondent shall deliver this order to such current personnel within thirty (30) days after service of this order, and to such future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person

requirements.description: Deliver order to future personnel within thirty days after the person assumes position or responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: after service of this order, and to such future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities. Respondent must secure a signed and dated statement

requirements.description: Secure signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of order within thirty days of delivery from all persons receiving a copy
requirements.quoted_text: assumes such position or responsibilities. Respondent must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this order, within thirty (30) days of delivery, from all persons receiving a copy of the order pursuant to this section.

provisions.title: Corporate Change Notification
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission within fourteen days of any corporate changes that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, bankruptcy, or name changes.

requirements.description: Notify Commission within fourteen days of any change in corporation that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, successor corporation, creation or dissolution of subsidiary/parent/affiliate, bankruptcy filing, or change in corporate name or address
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall notify the Commission within fourteen (14) days of any change in the corporation(s) that may affect compliance obligations arising under this order, including, but not limited to: a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor corporation; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this order; the proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or a change in the corporate name or address.

requirements.description: Send all notices by email to Debrief@ftc.gov or overnight courier to Associate Director of Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, with subject line beginning 'In re Forensics Consulting Solutions, LLC, FTC File No. 1523185'
requirements.quoted_text: Unless otherwise directed by a representative of the Commission in writing, all notices required by this Part shall be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier (not the U.S. Postal Service) to: Associate Director of Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, 600 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Washington, D.C. 20580. The subject line must begin: In re Forensics Consulting Solutions, LLC, FTC File No. 1523185.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a true and accurate written compliance report with the Commission within sixty days after service of the order, and submit additional reports within ten days upon written notice from the Commission.

requirements.description: File with Commission a true and accurate report in writing setting forth in detail the manner and form of compliance with the order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent, and its successors and assigns, within sixty (60) days after the date of service of this order, shall file with the Commission a true and accurate report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this order. Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission,

requirements.description: Submit additional true and accurate written report within ten days of receipt of written notice from Commission representative
requirements.quoted_text: order. Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission, it shall submit an additional true and accurate written report.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: The order will terminate on September 29, 2035 or twenty years from the most recent filing of a federal court complaint alleging violation of the order, whichever comes later, with specific provisions for dismissal or appeal outcomes.

requirements.description: Order terminates on September 29, 2035 or twenty years from issuance or twenty years from most recent date of federal court complaint filing alleging violation, whichever comes later
requirements.quoted_text: This order will terminate on September 29, 2035 or twenty (20) years from the date of its issuance, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of:

duration.termination_text: This order will terminate on September 29, 2035 or twenty (20) years from the date of its issuance, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later
